intro: Anchusa maculata, commonly known as the spotted gentian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, sometimes glandular, stems and leaves. Its flowers are tubular with five lobes and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Anchusa maculata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
